page.title: 18THE PEDLAR OF SWAFFHAM
page.content: The legend tells of one John Chapman, who was a merchant or pedlar living in Swaffham in the early Fifteenth Century, who had a vivid dream that if he went to London Bridge he would meet there a man who would make his fortune.He went and met a shopkeeper who told John that he had had a dream about a man called Chapman, from a town called Swaffham, in whose garden was a tree, under which was a pot of gold. John hurried home and dug up the gold in a brass pot. On selling the pot a potential purchaser translated an inscription which asserted that a further, larger pot was under the original. Again John held his peace and went home to dig up the pot. He used some of the money to help the church during the rebuilding in the C15th.
